title: Delaware Water Gap National Recreation Area: Features: Volunteers
body: Explore This Park    Learn About the Park     History & Culture     People     Volunteerism     Features: Volunteers                  Articles on Volunteerism      Most of the features below were first published in one of the park's newsletters:   Spanning the Gap (STG) 1985 - 2007 Guide to the Gap (GTG) 2011 - present National Park Service's Cultural Resource Management (CRM) magazine     individual Volunteers VIP Treatment (STG: Spring 1997 Vol. 19, No. 1) A summer as a park volunteer in historic preservation. Living Treasures: A Life in History: Len Peck (STG: Summer 2007 Vol. 29 No. 1) The 97-year-old preservationist and park volunteer.      Group Volunteers Down by the Riverside (under People: Groups)    Camp Staff Breathes New Life into Old Cabin CRM (Cultural Resource Management) Magazine: Saved from the Dam  Delaware Water Gap National Recreation Area Issue (Vol. 25 No.3 2002)  Preserving and Interpreting Historic Houses: VIPS Show the Way CRM (Cultural Resource Management) Magazine: Saved from the Dam Delaware Water Gap National Recreation Area Issue (Vol. 25 No.3 2002)
